page.title: 08RESIDENTS IN BURY & HOUGHTON
page.content: There is a tremendous variety in the occupations of people living in such a small area. Many are retired and come from large conurbations looking for a place of quiet together with lovely countryside. Others are working in the professions, commuting mainly to London, Brighton or other commercial centres, and have moved into the area comparatively recently over the last 25 years. The majority of the other residents were born in the village and work at the more traditional activities such as agricultural workers or domestic helpers. Similarly there is a great difference in the ages of the parents or grandparents these varying from the early twenties to the late nineties. The older people of course have no children living with them, but the younger families have an average of about 3 children. (cont..)
